entry.title: Marguerite Vaillant-Couturier (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that French soprano Marguerite Vaillant-Couturier created the role of Micaëla in the world premiere of Lecocq's Le coeur et la main (pictured) in Paris in 1882?

entry.title: championship game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 2022 USFL playoffs and championship game could not be played in Birmingham, Alabama, as the rest of the season was, due to the 2022 World Games?

entry.title: Bruno Pereira (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bruno Pereira, an expert in the indigenous people of Brazil, and journalist Dom Phillips were killed while on a trip in the Vale do Javari?

entry.title: a Tennessee radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a founder of a Tennessee radio station bought it back from the same group he had sold it to, who in turn had bought it back themselves?

entry.title: climate change in Italy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 2022 Marmolada serac collapse was caused by climate change in Italy?

entry.title: Lance McCullers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that doctors told Lance McCullers that he should not continue to pitch in 1990, but he returned to Major League Baseball in 1992?

entry.title: displaced aggression (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that displaced aggression is experienced by humans and animals?

entry.title: deep fried egg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a kind of deep fried egg dish might be perceived as a warning in Thai folklore?
